titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C27

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab: <lb n="c57-0117__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0117.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 14th<lb n="c57-0117__main__2"/><lb n="c57-0117__left_margin__1"/>I was soon <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19028__Start"/>int<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19028__End"/> introduced into the presence of the <lb n="c57-0117__main__3"/>Magistrate; an<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19033__Start"/>d<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19033__End"/> old benevolent man with <lb n="c57-0117__main__4"/>calm & mild manners. He looked <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19040__Start"/>towards<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19040__End"/>upon me <lb n="c57-0117__main__5"/>however with some degree of severity, and then <lb n="c57-0117__main__6"/>turning towards my conductors <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19052__Start"/>wh<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19052__End"/> he <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19055__Start"/>h<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19055__End"/> asked who <lb n="c57-0117__main__7"/><del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19060__Start"/>it was that<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19060__End"/><del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19063__Start"/>there were who<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19063__End"/> appeared as wit<lb n="c57-0117__main__8"/>nesses on this occasion. about half a dozen <lb n="c57-0117__main__9"/>men came forward and one being selected <lb n="c57-0117__main__10"/>by the magistrate he deposed that he had been <lb n="c57-0117__main__11"/>out fishing the night before with his son &<lb n="c57-0117__main__12"/>his brother-in-law, Daniel Nugent, when <lb n="c57-0117__main__13"/>about nine o clock they observed a strong <lb n="c57-0117__main__14"/>northerly blast rising & they accordingly put <lb n="c57-0117__main__15"/>in for port. It was a very dark night as <lb n="c57-0117__main__16"/>the moon had not yet risen; They did not <lb n="c57-0117__main__17"/>land at the harbour but, as they had been <lb n="c57-0117__main__18"/>accustomed, at a creek about two miles <lb n="c57-0117__main__19"/>below. He went first carrying a part <lb n="c57-0117__main__20"/>of the fishing tackle & his companions <lb n="c57-0117__main__21"/>followed him at some distance. As he <lb n="c57-0117__main__22"/>was walking along the sands he <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19121__Start"/>hit<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19121__End"/>struck his foot <lb n="c57-0117__main__23"/>against somthing & fell all his length on <lb n="c57-0117__main__24"/>the ground; his comrades came up to assist <lb n="c57-0117__main__25"/>him & by the light of their lantern they <lb n="c57-0117__main__26"/>discovered that he had fallen on the <lb n="c57-0117__main__27"/>body of a man who was to all appearance <lb n="c57-0117__main__28"/>dead.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0117__main__29"/>Their first supposition was that <lb n="c57-0117__main__30"/>it was the corpse of <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19150__Start"/>man<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19150__End"/>some person who had been <lb n="c57-0117__main__31"/>drowned & thrown on shore by the waves, <lb n="c57-0117__main__32"/>But upon examination they found that <lb n="c57-0117__main__33"/>the clothes were not wet &<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>even that the body <lb n="c57-0117__main__34"/>was not yet cold. They instantly carried <lb n="c57-0117__main__35"/>it to the cottage of an old woman <lb n="c57-0117__main__36"/>near the spot& endeavoured <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>but in vain to restore it to life <del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19193__Start"/>but<del loc="c57-0117__main__d1e19193__End"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__1"/><del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19201__Start"/>In vain<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19201__End"/>. He appeared to have been a handsome <lb n="c57-0118__main__2"/>young man about twenty years of age. He <lb n="c57-0118__main__3"/>had apparently been strangled for there <lb n="c57-0118__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0118__left_margin__1"/>was no sign of any violence except the black <lb n="c57-0118__main__5"/>mark of fingers on his neck.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__6"/>The first <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>part of this deposition did not <lb n="c57-0118__main__7"/>in the least interrest me but when the <lb n="c57-0118__main__8"/>mark of the fingers was mentioned I remem<lb n="c57-0118__main__9"/>bered the <del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19244__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19244__End"/> murder of my brother & felt <lb n="c57-0118__main__10"/>myself extremely agitated; my limbs trembled <lb n="c57-0118__main__11"/>& a mist came over my eyes which obliged <lb n="c57-0118__main__12"/>me to lean on a chair for support; the <lb n="c57-0118__main__13"/>Magistrate observed me with a keen eye <lb n="c57-0118__main__14"/>& of course drew an unfavourable augury f<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>rom <lb n="c57-0118__main__15"/><del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19279__Start"/>it.<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19279__End"/> my manner.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__16"/>The son confirmed his fathers account <lb n="c57-0118__main__17"/>but when Daniel Nugent was questioned <lb n="c57-0118__main__18"/>he swore positively that just before the <lb n="c57-0118__main__19"/>fall of his companion he saw a boat with <lb n="c57-0118__main__20"/>a single man in it <del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19297__Start"/>push<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19297__End"/><del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19300__Start"/>about fifty yar<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19300__End"/>at a short distance<lb n="c57-0118__main__21"/>from the shore & as far as he could judge <lb n="c57-0118__main__22"/>by the light of a few stars it was the same <lb n="c57-0118__main__23"/>boat in which I had just landed.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__24"/>A woman deposed that she lived near <lb n="c57-0118__main__25"/>the beach & was standing at the door of her <lb n="c57-0118__main__26"/>cottage waiting for the return <del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19324__Start"/>when<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19324__End"/>of the fisherman about <lb n="c57-0118__main__27"/><del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19335__Start"/>ten minutes<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19335__End"/><lb n="c57-0118__left_margin__1"/><del loc="c57-0118__left_margin__d1e19344__Start"/>half a quarter of<del loc="c57-0118__left_margin__d1e19344__End"/><del loc="c57-0118__left_margin__d1e19348__Start"/>half<del loc="c57-0118__left_margin__d1e19348__End"/>an hour before she heard of the dis<lb n="c57-0118__main__28"/>covery of the body she saw a boat with only <lb n="c57-0118__main__29"/>one <del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19365__Start"/>w<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19365__End"/> man in it push off from that <lb n="c57-0118__main__30"/>part of the shore where the corpse was <lb n="c57-0118__main__31"/>afterwards found.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__32"/>Another woman confirmed the ac<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19379__Start"/>c<del loc="c57-0118__main__d1e19379__End"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__33"/>count of the fisherman having brought the <lb n="c57-0118__main__34"/>body into her house.–It was not cold &<lb n="c57-0118__main__35"/>they put <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it into a bed & rubbed it and Daniel<lb n="c57-0119__main__1"/>went to the town for an appothecary, but <lb n="c57-0119__main__2"/>life was quite gone.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0119__main__3"/>Several other men <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19419__Start"/>deposed con<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19419__End"/><lb n="c57-0119__main__4"/>were examined concerning my landing & they <lb n="c57-0119__main__5"/>agreed that with the strong north wind that <lb n="c57-0119__main__6"/>had arrisen during the night it was very <lb n="c57-0119__main__7"/>probable that I had beaten about for <lb n="c57-0119__main__8"/>many hours & have been obliged to return <lb n="c57-0119__main__9"/><lb n="c57-0119__left_margin__1"/>nearly to the same <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19444__Start"/>place<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19444__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>spot from which I had <lb n="c57-0119__main__10"/><del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19456__Start"/>set out<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19456__End"/> departed. Besides, they observed, <lb n="c57-0119__main__11"/>that it appeared I had brought the body <lb n="c57-0119__main__12"/>from another place & it was likely <lb n="c57-0119__main__13"/>that <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19466__Start"/>I might<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19466__End"/><del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19469__Start"/>p<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19469__End"/> as I did not appear to know <lb n="c57-0119__main__14"/>the shore I might have put in to the <lb n="c57-0119__main__15"/>harbour ignorant of the distance <lb n="c57-0119__main__16"/>of the town of —— from the place where <lb n="c57-0119__main__17"/>I had deposited the <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19482__Start"/>body<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19482__End"/><del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19484__Start"/>.<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19484__End"/> corpse.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0119__main__18"/>>Mr. Kirwin on hearing this evidence <lb n="c57-0119__main__19"/>desired that I should be taken into the <lb n="c57-0119__main__20"/>room where the body lay for interment <lb n="c57-0119__main__21"/>that it might be observed what effect <lb n="c57-0119__main__22"/>the sight of it would produce<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19506__Start"/>d<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19506__End"/> upon me. <lb n="c57-0119__main__23"/>This idea was probably suggested by <lb n="c57-0119__main__24"/>the extreme agitation I had exhibited <lb n="c57-0119__main__25"/><del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19515__Start"/>th<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19515__End"/> when the mode of the murder had <lb n="c57-0119__main__26"/>been <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19520__Start"/>describ<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19520__End"/> described. I was according<lb n="c57-0119__main__27"/>ly conducted by the Magistrate & several <lb n="c57-0119__main__28"/>other persons to the Inn. I could not <lb n="c57-0119__main__29"/>help being struck by the strange coin<lb n="c57-0119__main__30"/>cidences that had taken place during <lb n="c57-0119__main__31"/>this eventful night but knowing that <lb n="c57-0119__main__32"/>I had been <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19545__Start"/>in<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19545__End"/> conversing with several <lb n="c57-0119__main__33"/>persons in the island I had inhabited <lb n="c57-0119__main__34"/>about the time that the body <del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19555__Start"/>was<del loc="c57-0119__main__d1e19555__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had been found<lb n="c57-0120__main__1"/>I was perfectly tranquil as to the consequences of the <lb n="c57-0120__main__2"/>affair.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__3"/>I entered the room where the <del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19582__Start"/>body<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19582__End"/>corpse lay <lb n="c57-0120__main__4"/>& was led up to the coffin. How can I describle?<lb n="c57-0120__main__5"/>my sensation. I feel yet parched with horror <lb n="c57-0120__main__6"/>nor can I ever reflect on that terrible <lb n="c57-0120__main__7"/>moment without shuddering & agony that <lb n="c57-0120__main__8"/>faintly reminds of the anguish of <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>therecogni<lb n="c57-0120__main__9"/>tion. The trial, the presence of the <lb n="c57-0120__main__10"/>magistrate & witnesses passed like a <lb n="c57-0120__main__11"/>dream from my memory when I saw <lb n="c57-0120__main__12"/>the lifeless form of Henry Cl<metamark>^</metamark>erval <lb n="c57-0120__main__13"/>stretched before me – I gasped for breath <lb n="c57-0120__main__14"/>& throwing myself on the body I exclaim<lb n="c57-0120__main__15"/>ed. And have my murderous machi<lb n="c57-0120__main__16"/>nations deprived you <del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19663__Start"/>alls<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19663__End"/> also my <lb n="c57-0120__main__17"/>dearest Henry of life— Two <del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19668__Start"/>w<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19668__End"/><del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19671__Start"/>victims<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19671__End"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__18"/>I have already destroyed; other victims <lb n="c57-0120__main__19"/>await their destinny – But you, Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval, <lb n="c57-0120__main__20"/>my frend, my benefactor!—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__21"/>The human frame could no longer <lb n="c57-0120__main__22"/>support the agonizing suffering that I <lb n="c57-0120__main__23"/>endured & I was carried out of the room <lb n="c57-0120__main__24"/>in strong convulsions.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__25"/>A fever succeeded to this. I lay for two <lb n="c57-0120__main__26"/>months on the point of death. My ravings, <lb n="c57-0120__main__27"/>as I afterwards heard were frightful. I called <lb n="c57-0120__main__28"/>myself the murderer of William <del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19722__Start"/>of<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19722__End"/>Jus Wil <lb n="c57-0120__main__29"/>liam, <del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19732__Start"/>&<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19732__End"/> of Justine & of <del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19735__Start"/>Cl<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19735__End"/> Cl<metamark place="sublinear">^</metamark>erval. Sometimes <lb n="c57-0120__main__30"/>I entreated my attendants to assist me in <lb n="c57-0120__main__31"/>the destruction of the fiend by whom <lb n="c57-0120__main__32"/>I was tormented – and at others I felt the <lb n="c57-0120__main__33"/><del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19759__Start"/>fangs<del loc="c57-0120__main__d1e19759__End"/><lb n="c57-0120__left_margin__1"/>fingers of the mosnster already grasping my<lb n="c57-0121__main__1"/>neck & screamed aloud with agony & terror. <lb n="c57-0121__main__2"/>Fortunately as I spoke my native tongue <lb n="c57-0121__main__3"/>Mr. Kirwin alone understood <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me. But my gestures <lb n="c57-0121__main__4"/>and bitter cries were sufficient, to affright <lb n="c57-0121__main__5"/>the other witnesses.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0121__main__6"/>Why did I not die? More miserable <lb n="c57-0121__main__7"/>than man ever was before why did I <lb n="c57-0121__main__8"/>not sink into rest & forgetfullness? Death <lb n="c57-0121__main__9"/>snatches away many blooming children the <lb n="c57-0121__main__10"/><del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19817__Start"/>oly<del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19817__End"/> only hopes of their doating <del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19820__Start"/>per<del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19820__End"/> parents; <lb n="c57-0121__main__11"/>How many brides & youthful lovers have <lb n="c57-0121__main__12"/>been one day in the bloom of health &<lb n="c57-0121__main__13"/>hope & the next a prey for worms & the <lb n="c57-0121__main__14"/>decay of the tomb! Of what materials was I <lb n="c57-0121__main__15"/>made <del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19834__Start"/>w<del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19834__End"/> that I could thus resist so many <lb n="c57-0121__main__16"/>shocks which like the turning of the wheel <lb n="c57-0121__main__17"/><lb n="c57-0121__left_margin__1"/>continually renewed the torture.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0121__main__18"/>But I was doomed to live & in two <lb n="c57-0121__main__19"/>months found myself <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>as awaking from a <lb n="c57-0121__main__20"/>dream, in a prison, stretched on a wretched <lb n="c57-0121__main__21"/>bed surrounded by gailors–turnkeys, bolts <lb n="c57-0121__main__22"/>& all the miserable apparatus of a dungeon <lb n="c57-0121__main__23"/>It was morning I remember when I thus awoke <lb n="c57-0121__main__24"/>I had forgotten <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the particulars of what had happened & only <lb n="c57-0121__main__25"/>felt as if some great misery had over<lb n="c57-0121__main__26"/>come me. But when I looked around <lb n="c57-0121__main__27"/>and saw the barred windows, & the <lb n="c57-0121__main__28"/>squalidness of the room in which I was, <lb n="c57-0121__main__29"/>all flashed across my memory –& I <lb n="c57-0121__main__30"/>groaned bitterly. This sound disturbed an <lb n="c57-0121__main__31"/>old woman who was sleeping in a <lb n="c57-0121__main__32"/>chair beside me. She was a hired nurse, <lb n="c57-0121__main__33"/>the wife of one of the turnkeys & her <lb n="c57-0121__main__34"/>countenance expressed all those bad qua<lb n="c57-0121__main__35"/>lities which <del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19929__Start"/>usually<del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19929__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>often characterize <del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19940__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0121__main__d1e19940__End"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__1"/>that class. her face was hard & rude like that <lb n="c57-0122__main__2"/>of persons accustomed to see without sympa<lb n="c57-0122__main__3"/>thizing in sights of misery. <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e19964__Start"/>She spoke with a<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e19964__End"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0122__left_margin__1"/>Her voice <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e19978__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e19978__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>expressed her entire indifference – She <lb n="c57-0122__main__5"/>addressed me in Eglish & the words struck <lb n="c57-0122__main__6"/>me as one that I had heard during my suff <lb n="c57-0122__main__7"/>erings– Are you better now, Sir, said she.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__8"/>I replied in the same language <lb n="c57-0122__main__9"/>with a feeble voice; I believe I am but <lb n="c57-0122__main__10"/>if it all be true – if indeed I did not <lb n="c57-0122__main__11"/>dream I am sorry that I am still alive <lb n="c57-0122__main__12"/>to feel misery & horror.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__13"/>For that matter, replied the old <lb n="c57-0122__main__14"/><del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20027__Start"/>wan<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20027__End"/> woman, if you mean about <lb n="c57-0122__main__15"/>the gentleman that you murdered I <lb n="c57-0122__main__16"/>believe that it were better for you <lb n="c57-0122__main__17"/>if you were dead – for I fancy it will <lb n="c57-0122__main__18"/>go hard with you, <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20039__Start"/>but<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20039__End"/> you will be <lb n="c57-0122__main__19"/>hanged when the next session comes <lb n="c57-0122__main__20"/>on – however that is none of my business <lb n="c57-0122__main__21"/>I am sent <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20049__Start"/>for<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20049__End"/> to nurse you & get <lb n="c57-0122__main__22"/>you well–I do <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20054__Start"/>no more<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20054__End"/> my duty with <lb n="c57-0122__main__23"/>a safe conscience; it were well if every<lb n="c57-0122__main__24"/>body did the same.–<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__25"/>I turned <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20070__Start"/>fro<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20070__End"/> with lo<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20073__Start"/>o<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20073__End"/>athing from <lb n="c57-0122__main__26"/>the woman who could utter so un<lb n="c57-0122__main__27"/>feeling a speech to <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20097__Start"/>man<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20097__End"/>person just saved on <lb n="c57-0122__main__28"/>the very edge of death; but I felt languid <lb n="c57-0122__main__29"/>and unable to reflect on all that had <lb n="c57-0122__main__30"/>passed; <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20113__Start"/>It sometimes<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20113__End"/>The whole series of my life appeared as a dream <lb n="c57-0122__main__31"/>I sometimes <del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20122__Start"/>I<del loc="c57-0122__main__d1e20122__End"/> doubted if indeed it was not <lb n="c57-0122__main__32"/>all true but it never presented itself to<lb n="c57-0123__main__1"/>my mind with the face of reality.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0123__main__2"/><del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20137__Start"/>But<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20137__End"/>As the images that floated <lb n="c57-0123__main__3"/>before me became more distinct I grew <lb n="c57-0123__main__4"/>feverish; a darkness pressed around me<lb n="c57-0123__main__5"/><del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20155__Start"/>and<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20155__End"/> no person was near me who soothed <lb n="c57-0123__main__6"/>me with the gentle voice of love; no <lb n="c57-0123__main__7"/>dear hand supported me. The phys<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20171__Start"/>y<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20171__End"/>i<lb n="c57-0123__main__8"/>cian came & prescribed medecines & the <lb n="c57-0123__main__9"/>old woman prepared them for me <lb n="c57-0123__main__10"/>but utter carelessness was visible in <lb n="c57-0123__main__11"/>the first & the <del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20193__Start"/>marks<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20193__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>expression of brutality <del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20206__Start"/>were<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20206__End"/><lb n="c57-0123__left_margin__1"/>was <lb n="c57-0123__main__12"/>strongly impressed on the visage of <lb n="c57-0123__main__13"/>the second – <del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20221__Start"/>Besides<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20221__End"/> who could be <lb n="c57-0123__main__14"/>inte<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20227__Start"/>r<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20227__End"/>rested in the fate of a murderer <lb n="c57-0123__main__15"/><del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20231__Start"/>none<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20231__End"/> but the hangman who would <lb n="c57-0123__main__16"/>gain his fee? if he recovered only to <lb n="c57-0123__main__17"/>die by his hands.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0123__main__18"/>These were my first reflections <lb n="c57-0123__main__19"/>but I soon learned that Mr. Kir<lb n="c57-0123__main__20"/>win had shewn me extreme <lb n="c57-0123__main__21"/>kindness – He had caused the best room <lb n="c57-0123__main__22"/>in the prison to be prepared for me, <lb n="c57-0123__main__23"/>(wretched indeed was the best) And it <lb n="c57-0123__main__24"/>was he who had provided a physician <lb n="c57-0123__main__25"/>& attendants for me. It is true he sel<lb n="c57-0123__main__26"/>dom came to see me for although <lb n="c57-0123__main__27"/>he ardently desired to relieve the suffe<lb n="c57-0123__main__28"/>rings of every human creature he did <lb n="c57-0123__main__29"/>not wish to be present at the agonies <lb n="c57-0123__main__30"/>and miserable ravings of a murderer— <lb n="c57-0123__main__31"/>He came therefore sometimes to see <lb n="c57-0123__main__32"/>that I was not neglected, but his visits <lb n="c57-0123__main__33"/><del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20294__Start"/>wh<del loc="c57-0123__main__d1e20294__End"/> were short & at long intervals.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0123__main__34"/>One day when I was gradually re<lb n="c57-0123__main__35"/>coveringI was seated in a chair, my eyes half<lb n="c57-0124__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0124__left_margin__1"/>open,and my cheeks livid like those of death I was <lb n="c57-0124__main__2"/>overcome by gloom & misery and often <lb n="c57-0124__main__3"/>reflected whether I had better not seek death <lb n="c57-0124__main__4"/>that wait miserably pent up only to be <lb n="c57-0124__main__5"/>let loose in a world replete with <del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20342__Start"/>whrect<del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20342__End"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__6"/>wretchedness. At one time I considered whether <lb n="c57-0124__main__7"/>I should not delare myself guilty & suffer <lb n="c57-0124__main__8"/>the penalty of the law which in depriving <lb n="c57-0124__main__9"/>me of <del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20357__Start"/>w<del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20357__End"/> life would afford the only consola<lb n="c57-0124__main__10"/>tion that I was capable of receiving. Such <lb n="c57-0124__main__11"/>were my thoughts when the door of my <lb n="c57-0124__main__12"/>prison opened and Mr. Kirwin entered. <lb n="c57-0124__main__13"/>His countenance expressed sympathy <lb n="c57-0124__main__14"/>and kindness: he drew a chair close to <lb n="c57-0124__main__15"/>mine & addressed me in french.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__16"/>I fear, <del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20388__Start"/>said he<del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20388__End"/>, that this place <lb n="c57-0124__main__17"/>is very shocking to you; Can I do anything <lb n="c57-0124__main__18"/>to make you more comfortable.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__19"/>I thank you, replied I, but all <lb n="c57-0124__main__20"/>that you mention is nothing to me; <lb n="c57-0124__main__21"/><del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20403__Start"/>No one on earth is capable<del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20403__End"/> on the <lb n="c57-0124__main__22"/>whole earth there is no comfort which <lb n="c57-0124__main__23"/>I am capable of receiving.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__24"/>I know, <del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20415__Start"/>said Mr. Kirwin,<del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20415__End"/> that the <lb n="c57-0124__main__25"/>sympathy of a stranger can be <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>but little <lb n="c57-0124__main__26"/>relief to one borne down as you are by <lb n="c57-0124__main__27"/>so strange a misfortune But you <lb n="c57-0124__main__28"/>will I hope soon quit this unhappy <lb n="c57-0124__main__29"/>abode– for doubtless <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>evidence can be easily brought <lb n="c57-0124__main__30"/>to free you from the criminal charge<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__31"/>That, <del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20462__Start"/>I replied<del loc="c57-0124__main__d1e20462__End"/> is my least concern–I <lb n="c57-0124__main__32"/>am by a course of strange events, become <lb n="c57-0124__main__33"/>the most miserable of mortals. Persecuted <lb n="c57-0124__main__34"/>& tortured as I am & have been can death<lb n="c57-0125__main__1"/>be any evil to me?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__2"/>Nothing indeed <del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20482__Start"/>said Mr Kirwin<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20482__End"/> could <lb n="c57-0125__main__3"/>be more unfortunate & agonizing than the strange <lb n="c57-0125__main__4"/>chances that have lately <del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20497__Start"/>taken<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20497__End"/> occurred. <lb n="c57-0125__main__5"/>You were thrown, by some surprising <lb n="c57-0125__main__6"/>accident, on this shore, renowned for its <lb n="c57-0125__main__7"/>hospitality <del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20507__Start"/>but prejudiced against you.<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20507__End"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__8"/>Siezed immediately & charged with murder <lb n="c57-0125__main__9"/>the first sight that was presented to your <lb n="c57-0125__main__10"/>eyes was the body of your friend mur<lb n="c57-0125__main__11"/>dered in so unaccountable a manner <lb n="c57-0125__main__12"/>and placed by some fiend as it were across <lb n="c57-0125__main__13"/>your path— <del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20527__Start"/>I What a<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20527__End"/><del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20530__Start"/>Could such incidents<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20530__End"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__14"/>As Mr. Kirwin said this, notwithstanding <lb n="c57-0125__main__15"/>the agitation that I <del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20542__Start"/>fel<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20542__End"/> endured on this <lb n="c57-0125__main__16"/>retrospect of my sufferings–I also felt <lb n="c57-0125__main__17"/>considerable surprise at the knowledge <lb n="c57-0125__main__18"/>he seemed to possess concerning me. <lb n="c57-0125__main__19"/>I suppose some astonishment was expressed <lb n="c57-0125__main__20"/>in my countenance – for Mr. Kirwin <lb n="c57-0125__main__21"/>hastened to say – It was not untill a day <lb n="c57-0125__main__22"/>or two after your illness that I thought <lb n="c57-0125__main__23"/>of examining your dress that I might <lb n="c57-0125__main__24"/>discover some trace by which I could <lb n="c57-0125__main__25"/>send to your relations an account of your <lb n="c57-0125__main__26"/>misfortune and illness. I found several letters <lb n="c57-0125__main__27"/>among others one <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>which I discovered by its commence<lb n="c57-0125__main__28"/>ment to be from your father – I instant<lb n="c57-0125__main__29"/>ly wrote to Geneva – nearly two months has <lb n="c57-0125__main__30"/>passed since the departure of my letter — <lb n="c57-0125__main__31"/>But you are ill – even now you tremble <lb n="c57-0125__main__32"/><lb n="c57-0125__left_margin__1"/>You appear unfit for agitation of any kind.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__33"/>This suspence, <del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20615__Start"/>I cried<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20615__End"/> is a thousand <lb n="c57-0125__main__34"/>times worse than the most horrible <lb n="c57-0125__main__35"/>event –Tell me what new scene of dea<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20622__Start"/>l<del loc="c57-0125__main__d1e20622__End"/>th <lb n="c57-0125__main__36"/>has been acted & whose murder I am <lb n="c57-0125__main__37"/>now to lament.<lb n="c57-0126__main__1"/>Your family are all perfectly <del loc="c57-0126__main__d1e20637__Start"/>well<del loc="c57-0126__main__d1e20637__End"/> well, said <lb n="c57-0126__main__2"/>Mr. Kirwinsaid Mr. Kirwin, with gentleness; and some one, a <lb n="c57-0126__main__3"/>friend, is come to visit you.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__4"/>I do not know by what chain of <lb n="c57-0126__main__5"/>thought the idea presented itself but it <lb n="c57-0126__main__6"/>instantly darted into my mind that the <lb n="c57-0126__main__7"/>monster had come to mock at my misery <lb n="c57-0126__main__8"/>& taunt me with the death of Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval <lb n="c57-0126__main__9"/>as a new incitement to comply with <lb n="c57-0126__main__10"/>his hellish desires. I put my hand before <lb n="c57-0126__main__11"/>my eyes & cried out in agony –Oh! take <lb n="c57-0126__main__12"/>him away – I cannot see him for Gods <lb n="c57-0126__main__13"/>sake do not let him enter!<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__14"/><del loc="c57-0126__main__d1e20695__Start"/>Mr. Kirwin changed countenance<del loc="c57-0126__main__d1e20695__End"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__15"/>Mr. Kirwin regarded me with a <lb n="c57-0126__main__16"/>troubled countenance. He could not <lb n="c57-0126__main__17"/>help regarding my exclamation as a <lb n="c57-0126__main__18"/>presumption of my guilt & said in <lb n="c57-0126__main__19"/>rather severe tone – I should have <lb n="c57-0126__main__20"/>thought, young man, that the presence <lb n="c57-0126__main__21"/>of your Father would have been <lb n="c57-0126__main__22"/>welcome instead of inpiring such <lb n="c57-0126__main__23"/>violent repugnance.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__24"/>My father, said, I, while every fea<lb n="c57-0126__main__25"/>ture& every muscle was relaxed from <lb n="c57-0126__main__26"/>anguish to pleasure – Is my father indeed <lb n="c57-0126__main__27"/>come – how kind, how very kind! But <lb n="c57-0126__main__28"/>where is he, why does he not hasten <lb n="c57-0126__main__29"/>to me?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__30"/>My change of manner suprised &<lb n="c57-0126__main__31"/>pleased <del loc="c57-0126__main__d1e20758__Start"/>Mr. Kirwin<del loc="c57-0126__main__d1e20758__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the magistrate, perhaps he thought <lb n="c57-0126__main__32"/>that my former exclamation was a<lb n="c57-0127__main__1"/>momentary return of delirium and <lb n="c57-0127__main__2"/>now he instantly resumed his former <lb n="c57-0127__main__3"/>benevolence – He rose and quitted the room <lb n="c57-0127__main__4"/>with my nurse & in a minute my father <lb n="c57-0127__main__5"/>entered it.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0127__main__6"/>Nothing at this moment could <lb n="c57-0127__main__7"/>have given my greater pleasure than <lb n="c57-0127__main__8"/>the arrival of my father – I stretched <lb n="c57-0127__main__9"/>out my hand to him & cried – Are you then <lb n="c57-0127__main__10"/>safe & Elizabeth & Ernest.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0127__main__11"/>My father calmed me by his assu<lb n="c57-0127__main__12"/>rances of their welfare & told me <lb n="c57-0127__main__13"/>that he had not communicated my <lb n="c57-0127__main__14"/>imprisonment to my cousin but <lb n="c57-0127__main__15"/>merely mentioned my <del loc="c57-0127__main__d1e20823__Start"/>he<del loc="c57-0127__main__d1e20823__End"/> illness—And <lb n="c57-0127__main__16"/>what a place this is that you inhabit, <lb n="c57-0127__main__17"/>my son continued he looking mourn <lb n="c57-0127__main__18"/>fully at the barred windows and the <lb n="c57-0127__main__19"/>wretched appearance of the room; <lb n="c57-0127__main__20"/>You travelled to seek happiness but <lb n="c57-0127__main__21"/>a fatality seems to <del loc="c57-0127__main__d1e20847__Start"/>hang over<del loc="c57-0127__main__d1e20847__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>pursue you –And <lb n="c57-0127__main__22"/>poor Clerval.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0127__main__23"/>The name of my unfortunate &<lb n="c57-0127__main__24"/>murdered friend <del loc="c57-0127__main__d1e20873__Start"/>agitated<del loc="c57-0127__main__d1e20873__End"/> was too great <lb n="c57-0127__main__25"/>an agitation to be endured in my <lb n="c57-0127__main__26"/>weak state—I shed tears; Alas, yes, my father <lb n="c57-0127__main__27"/>said I, somedestiny of the most horrible <lb n="c57-0127__main__28"/>kind hangs over me, and I must live to <lb n="c57-0127__main__29"/>fulfil it, or surely I should have died <lb n="c57-0127__main__30"/>on the coffin of Henry.<lb n="c57-0128__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0128.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 15<lb n="c57-0128__main__2"/>We were not allowed to converse for any length <lb n="c57-0128__main__3"/>of time for the precarious state of my health rendered <lb n="c57-0128__main__4"/>every precaution <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20925__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20925__End"/> necessary that could ensure tranquillity. Mr.. Kirwin came in &<lb n="c57-0128__main__5"/>insisted that my <del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20940__Start"/>forces<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20940__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>strength should not be exhausted <lb n="c57-0128__main__6"/><del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20953__Start"/>by a prolonged con<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20953__End"/> by too much exertion. But <lb n="c57-0128__main__7"/>the appearance of my father was to me like <lb n="c57-0128__main__8"/>that of my good angel, and I gradually recovered my <lb n="c57-0128__main__9"/>health. As my sickness quitted me I was absorbed <lb n="c57-0128__main__10"/>by a <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>gloomy & black melancholy that nothing could dissipate– <lb n="c57-0128__main__11"/>The image of Clerval was for ever before me <lb n="c57-0128__main__12"/><del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20988__Start"/>pale<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e20988__End"/><lb n="c57-0128__left_margin__1"/>ghastly& murdered – More than once the agitation <lb n="c57-0128__main__13"/><del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21002__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21002__End"/>into which these reflections threw me into made my <lb n="c57-0128__main__14"/>friends dread a dangerous relapse<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__15"/>Alas! Why did they preserve so miserable <lb n="c57-0128__main__16"/>and detested a life? It was surely that I <lb n="c57-0128__main__17"/>might fulfil my destiny which is drawing <lb n="c57-0128__main__18"/>to a close— Soon Oh very soon will death <lb n="c57-0128__main__19"/>extinguish these throbbings <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>releive me from this mighty weight <lb n="c57-0128__main__20"/>of anguish that bears me to the <del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21043__Start"/>ground<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21043__End"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__21"/>dust and in ex<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21049__Start"/>c<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21049__End"/>ecuting the award of jus<lb n="c57-0128__main__22"/>tice I shall also <del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21058__Start"/>thin<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21058__End"/> sink to rest. Then <lb n="c57-0128__main__23"/>the <del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21066__Start"/>thought<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21066__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>appearance of death was distant although <lb n="c57-0128__main__24"/>the wish was ever present to my thoughts <lb n="c57-0128__main__25"/>& I often sat for hours motionless &speech<lb n="c57-0128__main__26"/>less wishing for some mighty revolution <lb n="c57-0128__main__27"/>that might bury me & my destroyer in <lb n="c57-0128__main__28"/>its ruins.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__29"/>The season of the assizes approached– <lb n="c57-0128__main__30"/>I had already been three months in prison <lb n="c57-0128__main__31"/>&<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21103__Start"/>allth<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21103__End"/> although I was still weak &<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21106__Start"/>feverish<del loc="c57-0128__main__d1e21106__End"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__32"/>in continual danger of a relapse I was <lb n="c57-0128__main__33"/>obliged to travel nearly a hundred miles to <lb n="c57-0128__main__34"/>the county town where the court was held. <lb n="c57-0128__main__35"/>Mr. Kirwin charged himself with every<lb n="c57-0129__main__1"/>care of collecting witnesses and arranging <lb n="c57-0129__main__2"/>my defence– I was <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21130__Start"/>p<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21130__End"/> spared the disgrace <lb n="c57-0129__main__3"/>of appearing <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21137__Start"/>in the court<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21137__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>publickly as a criminal as <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21149__Start"/>my trial did<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21149__End"/><lb n="c57-0129__main__4"/>the case was not brought before the last <lb n="c57-0129__main__5"/>court court that decides on life & death— <lb n="c57-0129__main__6"/>The Grand Jury rejected the bill on its being <lb n="c57-0129__main__7"/>proved that I was in the orkney Island <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21174__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21174__End"/><lb n="c57-0129__main__8"/>at the hour the body <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21181__Start"/>was f<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21181__End"/><del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21184__Start"/>of m<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21184__End"/> of my friend was <lb n="c57-0129__main__9"/>found. And a fortnight after my removal <lb n="c57-0129__main__10"/>I was liberated from prison—My father was <lb n="c57-0129__main__11"/>enraptured on finding me freed from the <lb n="c57-0129__main__12"/>vexations of a criminal charge & that <lb n="c57-0129__main__13"/>I was again permitted to breathe the fresh <lb n="c57-0129__main__14"/>atmosphere & allowed to return to my <lb n="c57-0129__main__15"/>native country. I did not participate in <lb n="c57-0129__main__16"/>these feelings for to me the walls of a <lb n="c57-0129__main__17"/>dungeon or a <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21212__Start"/>plal<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21212__End"/> palace were alike <lb n="c57-0129__main__18"/>hateful – The cup of life was <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21218__Start"/>to me<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21218__End"/> poisoned <lb n="c57-0129__main__19"/>for ever & although the sun shone upon <lb n="c57-0129__main__20"/>me as <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>upon the happy &<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21235__Start"/>light<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21235__End"/>gay of heart I <lb n="c57-0129__main__21"/>saw around me nothing but a dense &<lb n="c57-0129__main__22"/>frightful darkness penetrated by no glimmer <lb n="c57-0129__main__23"/>but <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21247__Start"/>that of<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21247__End"/> the light of two eyes that <lb n="c57-0129__main__24"/>glared upon me.– Sometimes they were <lb n="c57-0129__main__25"/>the expressive eyes of Henry languishing <lb n="c57-0129__main__26"/>in death – the dark orbs nearly covered by <lb n="c57-0129__main__27"/>the lid & the <del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21259__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0129__main__d1e21259__End"/> long lashes that fringed <lb n="c57-0129__main__28"/>it – Sometimes it was the watry clouded <lb n="c57-0129__main__29"/>eyes of the monster as I first saw them <lb n="c57-0129__main__30"/>in my chamber at Ingolstadt<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0129__main__31"/>My father tried to awake <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in me the feelings <lb n="c57-0129__main__32"/>of affection — He talked of Geneva which I <lb n="c57-0129__main__33"/>should soon visit – Of Elizabeth & Ernest <lb n="c57-0129__main__34"/>But these words only drew from me deep <lb n="c57-0129__main__35"/>groans — Sometimes indeed I felt a wish<lb n="c57-0130__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0130__left_margin__1"/>for happiness; my beloved cousin & the blue lake which had <lb n="c57-0130__main__2"/>been so dear to me, in early childhood, but my <lb n="c57-0130__main__3"/>general <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>state of feeling was <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a torpor in which a prison <lb n="c57-0130__main__4"/>was as welcome a <del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21337__Start"/>scene<del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21337__End"/> residence as the divi<lb n="c57-0130__main__5"/>nest scene in nature & these fits were seldom <lb n="c57-0130__main__6"/>interrupted but by paroxisms of anguish &<lb n="c57-0130__main__7"/>despair – At these moments I often endeavour<lb n="c57-0130__main__8"/>ed to put an end to the existence I loathed <lb n="c57-0130__main__9"/>& it required unceasing attendance & vigilance <lb n="c57-0130__main__10"/>to <del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21364__Start"/>prevent<del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21364__End"/>restrain me from committing some dreadful <lb n="c57-0130__main__11"/>act of violence. I remember as I quitted the <lb n="c57-0130__main__12"/>prison I heard one of the men say – He may be <lb n="c57-0130__main__13"/>innocent of the murder but he has certainly <lb n="c57-0130__main__14"/>a bad conscience.–<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0130__main__15"/>These words struck me; a bad conscience, <lb n="c57-0130__main__16"/>yes surely I had one – William, Justine & Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval <lb n="c57-0130__main__17"/>had died <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>through my infernal machinations <lb n="c57-0130__main__18"/><del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21422__Start"/>And who is <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21430__Start"/>to be the<del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21430__End"/> next victim I exclaimed<del loc="c57-0130__main__d1e21422__End"/> And whose <lb n="c57-0130__main__19"/>death, cried I, is to finish the tragedy — Ah! my <lb n="c57-0130__main__20"/>father do not let us remain in this wretched <lb n="c57-0130__main__21"/>country– Take me where I can forget myself, <lb n="c57-0130__main__22"/>my existence & all the world. My father easily <lb n="c57-0130__main__23"/>acceeded to my desire & after having taken <lb n="c57-0130__main__24"/>leave of Mr. Kirwin we hastened to Dublin. <lb n="c57-0130__main__25"/>I felt as if I was relieved from a heavy weight <lb n="c57-0130__main__26"/>when the packet set sail with a fair wind <lb n="c57-0130__main__27"/>from Ireland and I had quitted for ever the <lb n="c57-0130__main__28"/>country which had been to me the scene <lb n="c57-0130__main__29"/>of so much misery – It was midnight, my <lb n="c57-0130__main__30"/>father slept below in the cabin & I lay on <lb n="c57-0130__main__31"/>the deck looking at the stars & listening to <lb n="c57-0130__main__32"/>the dashing of the waves –I hailed the darkness <lb n="c57-0130__main__33"/>that shut Ireland from my sight &<lb n="c57-0130__main__34"/>my pulse beat with a feverish joy when <lb n="c57-0130__main__35"/>I reflected that I should soon see Geneva <lb n="c57-0130__main__36"/>The passed appeared to me <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in the light of a fright<lb n="c57-0131__main__1"/>ful dream yet the <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21505__Start"/>place<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21505__End"/><del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21508__Start"/>vessel<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21508__End"/><del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21513__Start"/>in w<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21513__End"/> vessel in which <lb n="c57-0131__main__2"/>I was – <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21519__Start"/>the sea &<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21519__End"/> the wind that blew me from <lb n="c57-0131__main__3"/>the detested shore of Ireland and the sea <lb n="c57-0131__main__4"/>which surrounded me told me too forci<lb n="c57-0131__main__5"/>bly that I was deceived by no vision & that <lb n="c57-0131__main__6"/>Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval my friend & dearest companion <lb n="c57-0131__main__7"/>had fallen a victim to me & the <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21547__Start"/>animal<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21547__End"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__8"/><lb n="c57-0131__left_margin__1"/>mo<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>nster of my creation.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__9"/>I repassed in my memory my whole <lb n="c57-0131__main__10"/>life; my quiet happiness when residing with <lb n="c57-0131__main__11"/>my family in Geneva –The death of my Mother <lb n="c57-0131__main__12"/>and my departure for Insgolstadt; I remem<lb n="c57-0131__main__13"/>bered with shuddering the mad enthusiasm <lb n="c57-0131__main__14"/>that hurried me on to the creation of <lb n="c57-0131__main__15"/>my hideous enemy & I called to my mind <lb n="c57-0131__main__16"/>the night on which he first lived. <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21596__Start"/>I un<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21596__End"/>I<lb n="c57-0131__main__17"/><lb n="c57-0131__left_margin__1"/>I was unable to <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21617__Start"/>continue<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21617__End"/>pursue the train of thought –A <lb n="c57-0131__main__18"/>thousand feelings pressed upon me & I wept <lb n="c57-0131__main__19"/>bitterly.—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__20"/>Ever since my recovery from the fever <lb n="c57-0131__main__21"/>I had been in the custom of taking every <lb n="c57-0131__main__22"/>night a small quantity of laudanum <lb n="c57-0131__main__23"/><del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21639__Start"/>a<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21639__End"/> for it was by means of this drug only <lb n="c57-0131__main__24"/>that I was enabled to gain the <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21646__Start"/>sleep<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21646__End"/>restnecessa<lb n="c57-0131__main__25"/>ry for the preservation of life. O<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21660__Start"/>p<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21660__End"/>pressed <lb n="c57-0131__main__26"/>by the recollection of my various misfor<lb n="c57-0131__main__27"/>tunes I now took a double dose & soon <lb n="c57-0131__main__28"/>slept profoundly. But alas sleep did <lb n="c57-0131__main__29"/>not afford me <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21678__Start"/>rest<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21678__End"/>respite from thought &<lb n="c57-0131__main__30"/>misery – my dreams <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21687__Start"/>s<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21687__End"/>presented <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21690__Start"/>to me<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21690__End"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__31"/>a thousand objects that scared me– <lb n="c57-0131__main__32"/>towards morning I was <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21704__Start"/>opp<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21704__End"/> possessed by <lb n="c57-0131__main__33"/>a kind of nightmare – I felt the fiends <lb n="c57-0131__main__34"/>grasp on my neck and could not free <lb n="c57-0131__main__35"/>myself from it—Groans & cries rung in my <lb n="c57-0131__main__36"/>ears– My father who was watching over me, <lb n="c57-0131__main__37"/><del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21717__Start"/>and<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21717__End"/> perceiving my restlessness <del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21720__Start"/>he<del loc="c57-0131__main__d1e21720__End"/> awoke me<lb n="c57-0132__main__1"/>and pointed <del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21734__Start"/>and pointed<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21734__End"/> to the port of <lb n="c57-0132__main__2"/>Holyhead which we were now entering.
